meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of neoclassicism.
meanings.sent1: The neoclassical building had tall columns and simple designs.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed beautiful neoclassical sculptures from the 18th century.
meanings.sent3: The neoclassical painting looked like it was made by a time-traveling artist.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was neoclassical, drawing inspiration from ancient Greek literature.
meanings.sent5: The neoclassical music filled the room with a sense of elegance and tradition.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a revival or adaptation of the classical style in art, literature, architecture, etc.
meanings.sent1: The neoclassical architecture of the new library blended modern and traditional elements.
meanings.sent2: The artist's neoclassical paintings were inspired by ancient Roman frescoes.
meanings.sent3: The neoclassical fashion show featured togas and laurel wreaths on the runway.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a neoclassical touch, combining old wisdom with modern insights.
meanings.sent5: The neoclassical garden recreated the beauty of ancient Greek landscapes.
